title.narrative: Afghanistan: System Enhancement for Health Action in Transition Project

description.narrative: The project development objectives are to expand the scope, quality and coverage of health services provided to the population,particularly for the poor, in the project areas, and to enhance the stewardship functions of the Ministry of Public Health.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, A2 | Description :Recipient shall establish and maintain throughout Projectimplementation period, the Project Steering Committee to be responsible for, inter alia, general Project oversight and maintainingpolicy dialogue with development partners. | Due Date :30-Jun-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, A3 | Description :Recipient shall, throughout period of Project implementation, maintainthe Service Procurement and Contract Management Directorate (SPCMD) with qualified and experienced staff to be responsible forday-to-day management of service contracts under Part 1(a), (c) and (d) of the Project. | Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, A4 | Description :Recipient will ensure that the Finance Department of MOPH is fullystaffed and functional throughout the entire Project implementation period. | Frequency :Monthly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, B1(b) | Description :Recipient shall update and adopt the Project Financial Management asapproved by the Association. | Due Date :01-Jul-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, B2 | Description :Recipient will appoint and maintain an independent third partyevaluator to carry out regular evaluation of Project activities. | Due Date :31-Dec-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, D1 | Description :Recipient shall carry out Project in accordance with the HealthcareWaste Management Plan, Environmental and Social Management Framework and the Environmental Management Plans. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, D2 | Description :Recipient shall update the Healthcare Waste Management Plan in form andsubstance acceptable to the Association. | Due Date :31-Dec-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II, A1 | Description :Recipient shall prepare Project Reports covering the period of onecalendar semester and furnish to the Association not later than forty five (45) days after the end of the period covered by suchreport. | Frequency :SemiAnnual

title.narrative: Health Facility Utilization Rate: consultation per person per year
Proportion of children under five years with severe acute malnutrition who are treated
Score on the balanced scorecard examining quality of care in SCs, BHCs and CHCs
Score on the hospital balanced scorecard that examines quality of care in public hospitals delivering EPHS
PENTA3 coverage among children aged between 12 -23 months in lowest income quintile
Births (deliveries) attended by skilled health personnel (number)
Number of national hospitals with full budgetary autonomy
Percentage of IDUs reached by Needle Syringe Program
Pregnant women receiving antenatal care during a visit to a health provider (number)
Percentage of pregnant and lactating women who received counseling on infant and young child feeding (IYCF)
Proportion of MOPH core development budget executed
NGO contracts for BPHS/EPHS service delivery signed and properly managed as per agreed timeline
Proportion of budget from the Provincial Budgeting Initiative executed
The accreditation for procurement of goods and works achieved and maintained
Capacity of drug quality control lab developed
HIS annual report prepared and disseminated
